item.title: My new Post
item.description: import re string1="We have to extract these numbers 12, 47, 48 The integer s numbers are also interesting: 189 2036 314\',\' is a separator , so please extract these numbers 125,789,1450 and also these 56 4,90456 We like to offer you 7890$ per month in order to complet e this task... we are joking" print(string1) ## We have to extract these numbers 12, 47, 48 The integer s numbers are also interesting: 189 2036 314',' is a separator , so please extract these numbers 125,789,1450 and also these 56 4,90456 We like to offer you 7890$ per month in order to complet e this task.

item.title: Projects
item.description: Projects Here are some projects I have recently completed: Exploratory Data Analysis with Tidyverse Tools Modeling, Testing, and Classification

item.title: Comparing Brit Floyd and Billie Eilish Concert Tours 2020
item.description: #Data sets library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ───────────────── tidyverse 1.3.0 ── ## ✓ ggplot2 3.2.1 ✓ purrr 0.3.3 ## ✓ tibble 3.0.1 ✓ dplyr 0.8.5 ## ✓ tidyr 1.0.3 ✓ stringr 1.4.0 ## ✓ readr 1.3.1 ✓ forcats 0.5.0 ## ── Conflicts ──────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ## x dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## x dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() library("readxl") floyd<-read_excel("floyd.xlsx") billie <- read_excel("billie.xlsx") library(ggplot2) head(floyd) ## # A tibble: 6 x 7 ## Dofweek Month Date City State Country Price ## <chr> <dbl> <dbl> <chr> <chr> <chr> <dbl> ## 1 Fri 3 6 Pittsburgh PA USA 95 ## 2 Sat 3 7 Pittsburgh PA USA 86 ## 3 Sun 3 8 Erie PA USA 93 ## 4 Tues 3 10 Providence RI USA 58 ## 5 Wed 3 11 Worcester MA USA 61 ## 6 Fri 3 13 Kingston NY USA 50 glimpse(floyd) ## Rows: 54 ## Columns: 7 ## $ Dofweek <chr> "Fri", "Sat", "Sun", "Tues", "Wed", "Fri", "Sat", "Mon", "Tue… ## $ Month <dbl> 3, 3, 3, 3, 3, 3, 3, 3, 3, 3, 3, 3, 3, 3, 3, 3, 3, 3, 3, 4, 4… ## $ Date <dbl> 6, 7, 8, 10, 11, 13, 14, 16, 17, 18, 20, 21, 22, 24, 25, 26, … ## $ City <chr> "Pittsburgh", "Pittsburgh", "Erie", "Providence", "Worcester"… ## $ State <chr> "PA", "PA", "PA", "RI", "MA", "NY", "CT", "DC", "PA", "PA", "… ## $ Country <chr> "USA", "USA", "USA", "USA", "USA", "USA", "USA", "USA", "USA"… ## $ Price <dbl> 95.

item.title: Project 2: Modeling, Testing, and Predicting
item.description: library(knitr) hook_output = knit_hooks$get('output') knit_hooks$set(output = function(x, options) { # this hook is used only when the linewidth option is not NULL if (!is.null(n <- options$linewidth)) { x = knitr:::split_lines(x) # any lines wider than n should be wrapped if (any(nchar(x) > n)) x = strwrap(x, width = n) x = paste(x, collapse = '\n') } hook_output(x, options) }) knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE, eval = TRUE,fig.align="center",warning=FALSE,message=FALSE,fig.width=8, fig.height=5, linewidth=60) options(tibble.width = 100,width = 100) library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ───────────────── tidyverse 1.
